Post-Match Reflections: Jayson Tatum expressed that they must dig deeper after losing seven of their last 15 games.
Jaylen Brown believes they will be better and the first step toward improvement starts in the film room.
Kristaps Porzingis stated that they'll get past their current rough patch and is confident they'll bounce back.
Others: The Celtics returned home from a satisfying 3-1 Western Conference road trip only to be stunned by the Sacramento Kings, 114-97.
Sacramento Kings dominated the glass behind Domantas Sabonis’ career-high 28 rebounds.
The Celtics put up a solid 55-point first half against Sacramento but followed it up with just a 42-point second half.
Joe Mazzulla noted that they must be more consistent on offense as their inefficient offense puts pressure on their defense.
The Celtics were outscored 38-21 in the fourth quarter, during which they shot just 14.3 percent from three while the Kings shot 72.7 percent.
The team should be believed in because they’ve shown what they’re capable of when they’re operating at full strength for an extended period.
Friday’s game was just the third time all season that their main core played at full strength.
Their next opportunity to improve will be Sunday night when they host the New Orleans Pelicans before heading back on the road.
